page.title: 08The Environment
page.content: As part of our work for the Domesday project children from our school made visits into various parts of our area to survey the environment.On one trip we went to Brownwich Lane (locally pronounced Brunnidge) and attempted to walk a footpath which was quite clearly marked on the map. However, the path was very evidently overgrown with stinging nettles and we could not make our way through. We spoke to a lady about the path but she was quite unsure about where it came out. She gave us some different directions from the map. We felt that the path should have been cleared by the local council and decided to write to them to say so. But over a month later we have received no reply. We think it is important that these footpaths should be kept open.
